{"uri": "2024-05-349755860", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "04:46:48", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T04:46:48Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T04:21:31Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8549019694328308, "url": "https://www.republicworld.com/sports/football/matthijs-de-ligt-says-linesman-apologized-for-late-mistake-in-bayern-s-loss-to-madrid-in-ucl", "title": "Matthijs De Ligt says linesman apologized for late 'mistake' in Bayern's loss to Madrid in UCL", "body": "Bayern Munich players argues with referee Szymon Marciniak at the end of the Champions League semifinal second leg soccer match between Real Madrid and Bayern Munich at the Santiago Bernabeu stadium | Image: AP\n\nBayern Munich defender Matthijs de Ligt said the linesman apologized to him for raising the flag for offside before he scored what would have been a late equalizer in the Champions League semifinal against Real Madrid on Wednesday.\n\nDe Ligt scored deep into stoppage time for what would have been a 2-2 goal that likely would have sent the match into extra time at the Santiago Bernabeu Stadium. But the goal didn't count because the referee blew the whistle for the offside without letting the play be completed.\n\n\"The linesman said to me, 'I'm sorry, I made a mistake,'\" De Ligt said after the 2-1 loss in which Madrid's stoppage-time winner by Joselu came after a VAR intervention that overturned an initial offside call. In that occasion, though, the other linesman allowed the play to continue.\n\n\"The rule says that if it's not clear offside ... you have to keep playing.\" De Ligt said. \"And if you go in the last minute and you whistle like this, I think this is a big mistake. If it's offside or not, I don't know, VAR can check it, but if you don't check it, how can you see it? This is a shame.\"\n\nThe VAR also came into play in the 71st to disallow a Madrid goal because of a foul by defender Nacho Fern\u00e1ndez on Joshua Kimmich. Joselu had equalized in the 88th after a blunder by goalkeeper Manuel Neuer.\n\nThe victory sent Madrid into a final against Borussia Dortmund on June 1 in London.\n\nMadrid coach Carlo Ancelotti said his defenders stopped after the whistle was blown before the De Ligt goal.\n\n\"The last play is clear, the referee blows the whistle and we stop,\" he said. \"This referee is very good, he refereed in a World Cup final. They complain about this and we complain about the goal by Nacho that was disallowed. Kimmich threw himself to the ground.\"\n\nThe match referee was Szymon Marciniak, who officiated the 2022 World Cup final between Argentina and France in Qatar.\n\nBayern coach Thomas Tuchel said it was a \"disastrous decision from the linesman and from the referee.\"\n\n\"It feels almost like a betrayal in the end because of that decision,\" he said. \"The linesman said sorry. That does not help.\n\n\"To raise the flag in a decision like this, in a close decision in the last minute, and the referee as well... The referee does not have to whistle,\" Tuchel added. \"He sees that we win the second ball, he sees that we get the shot away. To whistle is a very very bad decision. It's against the rules and it's a bad decision from both of them.\"", "source": {"uri": "republicworld.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Republic World"}, "authors": [{"uri": "extractedDates": [{"amb": false, "imp": true, "date": "2024-06-01", "textStart": 1594, "textEnd": 1600}], "sentiment": 0.05882352941176472, "wgt": 218, "relevance": 1}
{"uri": "8118120615", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "22:04:09", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T22:04:09Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T22:03:26Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8509804010391235, "url": "https://www.sportingnews.com/us/champions-league/news/bayern-munich-goal-disallowed-error-offside-real-madrid-champions/c3f707628b3050fdf46fee13", "title": "Bayern Munich offside call: Why De Ligt goal vs Real Madrid in Champions League was disallowed without VAR", "body": "Real Madrid completed a miraculous comeback against Bayern Munich in the second leg of their Champions League semifinal, reaching the European title match against Borussia Dortmund by a 4-3 aggregate score.\n\nJoselu's late brace off the bench snatched victory from the jaws of defeat as the German side collapsed at the Bernabeu, appearing to be through on an Alphonso Davies thunderbolt but failing to hang on in a 2-1 defeat.\n\nHowever, the result didn't come without enormous controversy, as Bayern Munich had a late equalising goal by Matthijs de Ligt deep in stoppage time ruled out for offside. The assistant referee flagged for offside in the buildup to rule out the goal, and while replays appeared to show the decision was incorrect, it was not reviewed by VAR.\n\nThe Sporting News explains exactly what happened and why the goal was chalked off, and not reviewed by the offside technology.\n\nMORE: When is the Champions League final between Real Madrid and Borussia Dortmund?\n\nWith Real Madrid up 2-1 and the match deep into nine minutes of stoppage time, Bayern Munich threw everything forward hoping for a last-gasp equaliser to send the match to extra-time.\n\nA ball from deep was delivered by Bayern Munich towards the top of the penalty area, where Noussair Mazraoui battled for the ball with a defender. With the ball bobbling around, Bayern substitute Thomas Muller pounced, nodding it laterally to defender Matthijs de Ligt who was playing up as a striker as a desperation play from manager Thomas Tuchel.\n\nUSA: Watch the controversial disallowed goal by Matthijs de Ligt with analysis from broadcaster CBS\n\nDe Ligt managed to turn his defender and get on the ball, and rifled a shot past a confused Andriy Lunin who stood still almost as if he had stopped playing. That's because he had indeed stopped playing, because the whistle had blown prior to De Ligt's shot.\n\nThe official had blown his whistle, reacting to the assistant referee who had raised his flag for an offside offence on Mazraoui in the buildup. However, replays in the immediate aftermath showed that Mazraoui was quite tight with Real Madrid defender Antonio Rudiger, and may have actually been onside -- De Ligt was leaning just off, but he did not receive the ball from deep, Mazraoui did, and he was just behind Rudiger.\n\nNo worry, we have semi-automated offside technology to correct the decision, which came into play earlier in the match, seeing a Vinicius Jr goal count after initially being disallowed. Except, it wasn't...why?\n\nMORE: Recap the thrilling Champions League semifinal between Real Madrid and Bayern Munich\n\nWith the incident happening at the very end of the match between Real Madrid and Bayern Munich, broadcasters didn't have ample time to inform fans about what happened, and thus viewers will have been left confused about why the Matthijs de Ligt goal wasn't given after being initially ruled out for offside.\n\nIn fact, the incident wasn't even reviewed by VAR, because technically, it never happened. Because the referee blew his whistle before the end of the play, the shot cannot be reviewed by VAR as he stopped play before the shot occurred. That is why Real Madrid goalkeeper Andriy Lunin was standing still as De Ligt put the ball in the net, because he had reacted to the whistle.\n\nThus, the play was not reviewable by VAR. Ever since the introduction of VAR, assistant referees have been instructed to leave their flag down for an extra few beats to allow play to continue, such that if their decision is incorrect, they do not stop a promising attack with the wrong call.\n\nHowever, that instruction was not heeded here by either the assistant referee or the head official. Instead, the AR raised his flag immediately, and the head official blew his whistle in response, ending play early. While the decision would normally have been reviewable had the official not stopped play early, because he blew the play dead, it could not be reviewed.\n\nIt was a sharp departure from a refereeing mantra that has been in place for years, ever since VAR was introduced. While television broadcasters repeatedly complain about officials letting play continue, in their mind, too long before blowing dead for offside, this exact situation is what they are hoping to prevent by doing so.\n\nMORE: Who will win the 2024 Champions League final? Experts make their early predictions and picks\n\nThe all-Polish officiating crew for Real Madrid vs Bayern Munich at the Bernabeu was headlined by lead official Szymon Marciniak, who is one of the most experienced referees in not just Europe, but in the world.\n\nMarciniak is the two-time defending winner of the \"World's Best Referee\" award by the International Federation of Football History & Statistics (IFFHS), the organisation which is held largely responsible for keeping global football's official records and other historical markers.\n\nThanks to his nearly immaculate reputation, Marciniak has been handed two of football officiating's most prestigious assignments. He was the official for the 2023 Champions League final between Manchester City and Inter Milan, and he officiated the 2022 FIFA World Cup final between Argentina and France.\n\nAll this to say that Szymon Marciniak is as experienced as they come, but still committed a grave error. While Polish assistant Tomasz Listkiewicz raised his flag early, that does not stop play on its own. Even if the flag goes up, is down to Marciniak to allow play to continue or blow his whistle, and in this situation he made the clearly incorrect decision.\n\nBayern Munich manager Thomas Tuchel was understandably beside himself at the end of the match, feeling that his club was robbed of a spot in the Champions League final.\n\nBoth Tuchel and Matthijs de Ligt confirmed that the assistant referee personally admitted his mistake and apologised to both, but that was not enough to calm the fuming Bayern boss.\n\n\"The assistant referee apologised to me,\" Tuchel said, before claiming, \"what happened is a disaster and I cannot accept it.\"\n\nDe Ligt echoed that sentiment, saying, ''It is a shame, the assistant referee told me he made a mistake.''", "source": {"uri": {"uri": "8118226345", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "00:07:30", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T00:07:30Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T00:06:55Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8274509906768799, "url": "https://www.perthnow.com.au/sport/soccer/defender-says-linesman-apologised-for-offside-mistake-c-14601514", "title": "Defender says linesman apologised for offside 'mistake'", "body": "Bayern Munich defender Matthijs de Ligt says the linesman apologised to him for raising the flag for offside before he scored what would have been a late equaliser in the Champions League semi-final against Real Madrid.\n\nDe Ligt scored deep into stoppage time for what would have been a 2-2 goal that likely would have sent the match into extra time at the Santiago Bernabeu Stadium on Wednesday (Thursday AEST).\n\nBut the goal didn't count because the referee blew the whistle for offside without letting the play be completed.\n\n\"The linesman said to me, 'I'm sorry, I made a mistake',\" De Ligt said after the 2-1 loss in which Madrid's stoppage-time winner by Joselu came after a VAR intervention that overturned an initial offside call. On that occasion, though, the other linesman allowed the play to continue.\n\n\"The rule says that if it's not clear offside ... you have to keep playing,\" De Ligt said.\n\n\"And if you go in the last minute and you whistle like this, I think this is a big mistake. If it's offside or not, I don't know, VAR can check it, but if you don't check it, how can you see it? This is a shame.\"\n\nThe VAR also came into play in the 71st minute to disallow a Madrid goal because of a foul by defender Nacho Fernandez on Joshua Kimmich.\n\nThe victory sent Madrid into the final against Borussia Dortmund on June 1 in London.\n\nMadrid coach Carlo Ancelotti said his defenders stopped after the whistle was blown before the De Ligt goal.\n\n\"The last play is clear, the referee blows the whistle and we stop,\" he said.\n\n\"This referee is very good, he refereed in a World Cup final. They complain about this and we complain about the goal by Nacho that was disallowed. Kimmich threw himself to the ground.\"\n\nThe match referee was Szymon Marciniak, who officiated the 2022 World Cup final between Argentina and France in Qatar.\n\nBayern coach Thomas Tuchel said it was a \"disastrous decision from the linesman and from the referee\".\n\n\"It feels almost like a betrayal in the end because of that decision,\" he said. \"The linesman said sorry. That does not help.\n\n\"To raise the flag in a decision like this, in a close decision in the last minute, and the referee as well ... the referee does not have to whistle.\n\n\"He sees that we win the second ball, he sees that we get the shot away. To whistle is a very very bad decision. {"uri": "8118144331", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "22:28:24", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T22:28:24Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T22:27:38Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8235294222831726, "url": "https://www.givemesport.com/matthijs-de-ligt-reveals-what-linesman-told-him-after-disallowed-goal-v-real-madrid/", "title": "De Ligt reveals what the linesman told him after his controversial disallowed goal v Real Madrid", "body": "De Ligt was unhappy at the decision made and has since revealed what the linesman said to him in the aftermath.\n\nHighlights Matthijs De Ligt has claimed the linesman apologised for raising his flag despite uncertainty at an offside decision in the Champions League semi-final. Bayern Munich were beaten 2-1 after a late Joselu brace saved the 14-time winners following Alphonso Davies' stunning opener. Thomas Tuchel was left frustrated by the linesman's error, which prevented his side the opportunity to equalise in the dying moments.\n\nMatthijs de Ligt has claimed the linesman admitted to making a mistake in the final moments of Bayern Munich's 2-1 Champions League semi-final defeat against Real Madrid. The two sides were level after an entertaining 2-2 draw in Germany in the first leg.\n\nThe visitors even took a shock lead in the second-half after surviving Los Blancos' onslaught as Alphonso Davies tore down the left flank before cutting inside and firing a rocket into the far corner of the net with his weaker right foot. The Canadian has been linked with a move to the Bernabeu in the summer transfer window, but he stunned the home crowd with the wonderful goal, which looked to have secured a place in the final.\n\nGIVEMESPORT Key Statistic: Real Madrid haven't been defeated in a European final in over 40 years, with Aberdeen being the last side to beat the Spaniards in 1983.\n\nHowever, as is often the case with Real Madrid in European competition, there would be a twist in the tale. Newcastle United and Stoke City flop, Joselu, was the unlikely hero as the Spanish forward netted a brace in the 88th and 91st minutes of the game to knock Thomas Tuchel's side out.\n\nRelated Real Madrid 2-1 Bayern Munich: Player Ratings and Match Highlights The side from Spain enjoyed a late double from Joselu to book a spot in the Champions League final once again.\n\nA controversial late decision by the linesman saw the flag raised and the whistle blown just seconds before Bayern Munich put the ball in the net for a second time. VAR is often relied upon to make tight offside calls, but on this occasion, the assistant referee took matters into his own hands. View the controversial moment below:\n\nDe Ligt Claims the Linesman Apologised The defender had the ball in the net\n\nReplays showed that the player in question looked to be in an onside position and, due to how fine the margins were, the decision likely should have been left up to the semi-automated offside technology to ensure accuracy.\n\nOne man that was disappointed with the decision to stop play from unfolding was De Ligt. The Dutch defender was the man who eventually put the ball in the back of the net, only to be denied by the linesman's flag. De Ligt cut a frustrated figure as he explained his version of events to beIN Sports:\n\n\"I think we made rules in football, and the rules say if it's not a clear offside - which it wasn't - you have to keep playing. If you whistle like this in the last minute, I think this is a big mistake.\"\n\nDe Ligt also went on to say: \"The linesman said to me 'I'm sorry, I made a mistake.' I'm not the type of person to blame the loss on the referee so Madrid deserve to win because they won 2-1. But I think if it's a rule, it's a rule.\" View the clip below:\n\nThomas Tuchel Rues Linesman's Error The departing manager also claimed an apology was issued\n\nTuchel, who will leave Bayern Munich at the end of the 2023/24 season, was left disgruntled by the decision to not allow play to carry on, branding it: \"Disastrous decision from the linesman and the referee. It felt almost like a betrayal in the end.\"\n\nThe German had little time for any explanation that may be given for the incident as he also said in his post-match interview with TNT Sports: \"It was against the rules. It was a really really bad decision.\" View the Bayern Munich manager's comments:\n\nRelated 10 favourites to replace Thomas Tuchel at Bayern Munich The former Chelsea boss has confirmed that he will {"uri": "2024-05-349584098", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "23:20:33", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T23:20:33Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T19:00:00Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8196078538894653, "url": "https://www.usnews.com/news/sports/articles/2024-05-08/de-ligt-says-linesman-apologized-for-late-mistake-in-bayerns-loss-to-madrid-in-champions-league", "title": "De Ligt Says Linesman Apologized for Late 'Mistake' in Bayern's Loss to Madrid in Champions League", "body": "MADRID (AP) -- Bayern Munich defender Matthijs de Ligt said the linesman apologized to him for raising the flag for offside before he scored what would have been a late equalizer in the Champions League semifinal against Real Madrid on Wednesday.\n\nDe Ligt scored deep into stoppage time for what would have been a 2-2 goal that likely would have sent the match into extra time at the Santiago Bernabeu Stadium. But the goal didn't count because the referee blew the whistle for the offside without letting the play be completed.\n\n\"The linesman said to me, 'I'm sorry, I made a mistake,'\" De Ligt said after the 2-1 loss in which Madrid's stoppage-time winner by Joselu came after a VAR intervention that overturned an initial offside call. In that occasion, though, the other linesman allowed the play to continue.\n\n\"The rule says that if it's not clear offside ... you have to keep playing.\" De Ligt said. \"And if you go in the last minute and you whistle like this, I think this is a big mistake. If it's offside or not, I don't know, VAR can check it, but if you don't check it, how can you see it? This is a shame.\"\n\nThe VAR also came into play in the 71st to disallow a Madrid goal because of a foul by defender Nacho Fern\u00e1ndez on Joshua Kimmich. Joselu had equalized in the 88th after a blunder by goalkeeper Manuel Neuer.\n\nThe victory sent Madrid into a final against Borussia Dortmund on June 1 in London.\n\nMadrid coach Carlo Ancelotti said his defenders stopped after the whistle was blown before the De Ligt goal.\n\n\"The last play is clear, the referee blows the whistle and we stop,\" he said. \"This referee is very good, he refereed in a World Cup final. They complain about this and we complain about the goal by Nacho that was disallowed. Kimmich threw himself to the ground.\"\n\nThe match referee was Szymon Marciniak, who officiated the 2022 World Cup final between Argentina and France in Qatar.\n\nBayern coach Thomas Tuchel said it was a \"disastrous decision from the linesman and from the referee.\"\n\n\"It feels almost like a betrayal in the end because of that decision,\" he said. \"The linesman said sorry. That does not help.\n\n\"To raise the flag in a decision like this, in a close decision in the last minute, and the referee as well... The referee does not have to whistle,\" Tuchel added. \"He sees that we win the second ball, he sees that we get the shot away. To whistle is a very very bad decision. It's against the rules and it's a bad decision from both of them.\"\n\nCopyright 2024 The Associated Press. All rights reserved. {"uri": "2024-05-349595392", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "23:43:57", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T23:43:57Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T23:00:36Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8196078538894653, "url": "https://www.register-herald.com/sports/national_sports/de-ligt-says-linesman-apologized-for-late-mistake-in-bayerns-loss-to-madrid-in-champions/article_b16bfdc5-f233-5f41-9c3a-a2963445eba4.html", "title": "De Ligt says linesman apologized for late 'mistake' in Bayern's loss to Madrid in Champions League", "body": "MADRID (AP) -- Bayern Munich defender Matthijs de Ligt said the linesman apologized to him for raising the flag for offside before he scored what would have been a late equalizer in the Champions League semifinal against Real Madrid on Wednesday.\n\nDe Ligt scored deep into stoppage time for what would have been a 2-2 goal that likely would have sent the match into extra time at the Santiago Bernabeu Stadium. But the goal didn't count because the referee blew the whistle for the offside without letting the play be completed.\n\n\"The linesman said to me, 'I'm sorry, I made a mistake,'\" De Ligt said after the 2-1 loss in which Madrid's stoppage-time winner by Joselu came after a VAR intervention that overturned an initial offside call. In that occasion, though, the other linesman allowed the play to continue.\n\n\"The rule says that if it's not clear offside ... you have to keep playing.\" De Ligt said. \"And if you go in the last minute and you whistle like this, I think this is a big mistake. If it's offside or not, I don't know, VAR can check it, but if you don't check it, how can you see it? This is a shame.\"\n\nThe VAR also came into play in the 71st to disallow a Madrid goal because of a foul by defender Nacho Fern\u00e1ndez on Joshua Kimmich. Joselu had equalized in the 88th after a blunder by goalkeeper Manuel Neuer.\n\nThe victory sent Madrid into a final against Borussia Dortmund on June 1 in London.\n\nMadrid coach Carlo Ancelotti said his defenders stopped after the whistle was blown before the De Ligt goal.\n\n\"The last play is clear, the referee blows the whistle and we stop,\" he said. \"This referee is very good, he refereed in a World Cup final. They complain about this and we complain about the goal by Nacho that was disallowed. Kimmich threw himself to the ground.\"\n\nThe match referee was Szymon Marciniak, who officiated the 2022 World Cup final between Argentina and France in Qatar.\n\nBayern coach Thomas Tuchel said it was a \"disastrous decision from the linesman and from the referee.\"\n\n\"It feels almost like a betrayal in the end because of that decision,\" he said. \"The linesman said sorry. That does not help.\n\n\"To raise the flag in a decision like this, in a close decision in the last minute, and the referee as well... The referee does not have to whistle,\" Tuchel added. \"He sees that we win the second ball, he sees that we get the shot away. To whistle is a very very bad decision. It's against the rules and it's a bad decision from both of them.\"\n\nAP soccer: https://apnews.com/hub/soccer", "source": {"uri": "register-herald.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Beckley {"uri": "8118409385", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "03:47:20", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T03:47:20Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T03:45:39Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8156862854957581, "url": "https://www.firstpost.com/sports/football-news/bayern-munich-robbed-champions-league-real-madrid-13768835.html", "title": "Were Bayern Munich robbed in the Champions League semi-final against Real Madrid?", "body": "Bayern Munich had a goal ruled out for offside against Real Madrid deep into stoppage time. AP\n\nLate on in the second leg of the Champions League semi-final between Real Madrid and Bayern Munich, the German giants went for the equaliser. Just moments before, Joselu had turned the tie upside down with two goals in three minutes with Real Madrid leading the second leg 2-1 and 4-3 on aggregate .\n\nDesperate for an equaliser of their own and to force extra time, and maybe penalties, Bayern committed bodies forward. Joshua Kimmich put in a long pass which was headed centrally by Thomas Mueller for defender Matthijs de Ligt to score in the 12th minute of stoppage time.\n\nThe goal was ruled out for offside after the linesman had raised his flag earlier in the move before the ball went in the net, thus ruling out a VAR review.\n\nAn animated Bayern Munich manager Thomas Tuchel protested down the sideline following the decision. After the match, he told broadcaster DAZN the decision was \"a disaster, an absolute disaster\".\n\n\"We have to let the action play out until the end. That's the rule, especially since it's so close to the goal, and it's so limited.\n\n\"The first error is made by the linesman, the second comes from the referee,\" Tuchel said.\n\nThe 50-year-old coach told broadcaster TNT the decision \"felt like a betrayal\".\n\nSpeaking at the press conference, Tuchel said the referee apologised but added: \"It doesn't help to say sorry.\n\n\"Everyone has to go to their limit, everyone has to suffer, everyone has to play without making mistakes. So the referee has to be at that level too.\n\n\"It just doesn't help to make excuses after the fact.\n\n\"You are on the field for this reason, because you are the best there is. And we have the right to expect that until the end.\"\n\nDe Ligt, who had the goal disallowed, agreed with his manager, calling the decision decisive.\n\n\"The rule says that if it's not clear offside &mldr; you have to keep playing.\u00e2\u20ac De Ligt said. \u00e2\u20ac\u0153And if you go in the last minute and you whistle like this, I think this is a big mistake. If it's offside or not, I don't know, VAR can check it, but if you don't check it, how can you see it? This is a shame.\u00e2\u20ac\n\nA disappointed Bayern captain Manuel Neuer said: \"We're in the Champions League semi-finals&mldr; I think he knows it was a mistake and that you shouldn't make a decision like that so quickly.\"\n\nVAR was needed in the 71st minute to disallow a Real Madrid goal because of a foul by Nacho Fernandez on Kimmich.\n\nReal Madrid manager Carlo Ancelotti said his defenders stopped after the whistle was blown before the De Ligt goal.\n\n\u00e2\u20ac\u0153The last play is clear, the referee blows the whistle and we stop,\u00e2\u20ac he said. \u00e2\u20ac\u0153This referee is very good, he refereed in a World Cup final. They complain about this and we complain about the goal by Nacho that was disallowed. {"uri": "8118688384", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "07:41:19", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T07:41:19Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T07:40:47Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8156862854957581, "url": "https://www.givemesport.com/new-footage-shows-whether-bayerns-disallowed-goal-was-correctly-ruled-out/", "title": "New footage clears up whether De Ligt's goal v Real Madrid was correctly ruled out for offside", "body": "Bayern Munich were denied a late equaliser against Real Madrid in the Champions League semi-finals by a controversial officiating decision.\n\nHighlights Matthijs de Ligt thought he had equalised for Bayern Munich in injury time but the referee had already blown his whistle after the linesman raised his flag. Replays show the decision was the incorrect one, with Bayern denied the opportunity to progress in extra-time. Bayern manager Thomas Tuchel was fuming after the match, branding the decision \"disastrous\".\n\nReal Madrid showed why they are the kings of the Champions League again on Wednesday night as they produced a stunning late comeback against Bayern Munich to reach another final. A brace from former Stoke forward Joselu turned the game on its head after Alphonso Davies' earlier goal.\n\nMadrid's victory was not without controversy, though, after Bayern were denied an injury-time equaliser by the linesman's flag. Matthijs de Ligt thought he had made it 2-2 when he swept the ball home from Thomas Muller's header but the referee had already blown his whistle for an offside against the former Ajax defender.\n\nDe Ligt, though, was not involved in that stage of the build-up play and should not have been flagged offside. Instead, it was De Ligt's teammate Noussair Mazrouai who challenged for the ball, and footage from beIN SPORTS appears to show that Mazrouai himself was not offside.\n\nVideo Clears Up Offside Debate Mazrouai was onside\n\nThe incident was a huge talking point on the night, with post-match reaction dominated by the disallowed goal rather than Joselu's remarkable brace. De Ligt himself revealed after the match that the linesman responsible for the error had apologised to him.\n\n\"If it's offside, it's offside,\" De Ligt told beIN SPORTS. \"But I think we made rules in football and the rules are that if it's not a clear offside - which it wasn't because I don't see it yet, if it's offside or not - you have to keep playing.\n\n\"If you go in the last minutes and you whistle like this, I think it's a big mistake. If it's offside or not you can check it, but if you don't check it, how can you see it? The second goal (for Madrid), Rudiger is almost offside. If he whistles, OK, but now there's a difference and this is a shame.\n\n\"The linesman said to me, 'I'm sorry, I made a mistake.' I can't buy anything for that. I'm not the type of person who wants to blame a loss or win on the referee but it means you have to win because you win 2-1. I think if it's a rule, it's a rule.\"\n\nTuchel Brands Decision \"Disastrous\" \"The linesman said sorry but that does not help\"\n\nBayern manager Thomas Tuchel, meanwhile, blasted the officials, branding the decision \"disastrous\". He said: \"The linesman said sorry but that does not help. There are two mistakes. The first big mistake is from the linesman. He raised his flag straight away; to raise your flag in a situation like this, you have to be very, very sure it's offside.\n\n\"To have the guts, the balls, to raise the flag like this is a huge, huge call, and it is the wrong call. We got the shot away within five seconds [of the flag] and the referee has the chance not to whistle, but he whistles. It is against every rule.\"\n\nTuchel added: \"We accept that we lost, it is what it is, but it should not have happened. It would not have happened at the other end. It is tough to swallow. I am really angry. If \u00adanyone did not deserve that it's Manuel (Neuer, who made a mistake for Joselu's equaliser).\"\n\nRelated Carlo Ancelotti's Response to Bayern's Referee Complaints The Italian chief brushed But the goal didn't count because the referee blew the whistle for the offside without letting the play be completed.\n\n\"The linesman said to me, I'm sorry, I made a mistake,'\" De Ligt said after the 2-1 loss in which Madrid's stoppage-time winner by Joselu came after a VAR intervention that overturned an initial offside call. In that occasion, though, the other linesman allowed the play to continue.\n\n''The rule says that if it's not clear offside ... you have to keep playing.\" De Ligt said. \"And if you go in the last minute and you whistle like this, I think this is a big mistake. If it's offside or not, I don't know, VAR can check it, but if you don't check it, how can you see it? This is a shame.\" The VAR also came into play in the 71st to disallow a Madrid goal because of a foul by defender Nacho Fern\u00e1ndez on Joshua Kimmich. Joselu had equalized in the 88th after a blunder by goalkeeper Manuel Neuer.\n\nThe victory sent Madrid into a final against Borussia Dortmund on June 1 in London.\n\nMadrid coach Carlo Ancelotti said his defenders stopped after the whistle was blown before the De Ligt goal.\n\n\"The last play is clear, the referee blows the whistle and we stop,\" he said. \"This referee is very good, he refereed in a World Cup final. They complain about this and we complain about the goal by Nacho that was disallowed. Kimmich threw himself to the ground.\" The match referee was Szymon Marciniak, who officiated the 2022 World Cup final between Argentina and France in Qatar.\n\nBayern coach Thomas Tuchel said it was a \"disastrous decision from the linesman and from the referee.'' \"It feels almost like a betrayal in the end because of that decision,\" he said. ''The linesman said sorry. That does not help.\n\n\"To raise the flag in a decision like this, in a close decision in the last minute, and the referee as well... The referee does not have to whistle,'' Tuchel added. ''He sees that we win the second ball, he sees that we get the shot away. To whistle is a very very bad decision. {"uri": "2024-05-349541513", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "22:04:43", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T22:04:43Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T22:00:19Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8117647171020508, "url": "https://sports.yahoo.com/matthijs-ligt-linesman-apologized-offside-220019501.html", "title": "Matthijs de Ligt: Linesman apologized for offside call in Champions League semi  --  'Big mistake, big disgrace'", "body": "An epic finish to the UEFA Champions League semifinal between Real Madrid and Bayern Munich could've been even more legendary were it not for an apparent mistake from the officials on Wednesday in Spain.\n\nReal Madrid struck twice through Joselu to take a 2-1 second leg advantage and 4-3 aggregate lead over Bayern, but Matthis de Ligt seemed to have poked Bayern level in the 12th minute of stoppage time.\n\n[ MORE: Real Madrid 2-1 (4-3 agg) Bayern Munich recap, highlights ]\n\nBut no! The assistant referee had raised his flag for offside in the build-up and the referee blew the whistle before De Ligt released his shot. The whistle meant that VAR had no power to review the play for offside, and replays showed a decision would've been razor-thin.\n\nAn apology came, but it did not go over well with De Ligt and his teammates. And how could it? De Ligt could've had an all-time positive moment in Bayern history, and it didn't even merit a review.\n\nMatthijs de Ligt reaction to ending of Champions League semifinal\n\nDe Ligt was asked his opinion on the moment on beIN Sports after the game.\n\n\"If it's offside, it's offside, but we made rules in football and the rule says that if it's not a clear offside, which it wasn't, you have to keep playing,\" De Ligt said. \"If you go in the last minute and you whistle like this, I think this is a big mistake and a big disgrace. If it's offside or not, I don't know, you can check it but if you don't check it how can you see it. [On] the second goal of Joselu, [Antonio] Rudiger is almost also offside. If he whistles there, nothing, but now it's a difference.\"\n\n\"The linesman told me I'm sorry I made a mistake. I get nothing for that. In the end, I'm not the type of person who wants to blame losing or winning on the referee so Madrid deserves to win because they win 2-1 but if it's a rule, it's a rule, and it's the only thing I can say about it.\"\n\nWe are Bayern Munich and we haven't won anything. Today was the last chance to make a really good season and we lost. I'm proud of the fight we showed today because it's not easy to play here but in the end we won nothing so it's not really Bayern Munich. {"uri": "8118162371", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "22:50:12", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T22:50:12Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T22:49:29Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8039215803146362, "url": "https://theathletic.com/5480699/2024/05/08/de-ligt-goal-bayern-madrid-marciniak-listkiewicz/", "title": "Explaining De Ligt's controversial non-goal as Real Madrid vs Bayern Munich ends in 'a betrayal'", "body": "Once again the Champions League did not disappoint as Real Madrid and Bayern Munich played out a thrilling semi-final over two legs.\n\nBut the ending to their 180-minute slugfest was highly controversial, with Bayern potentially denied what would have been a late equaliser at the Bernabeu to send the second leg to extra-time.\n\nBayern defender Matthijs De Ligt thought he had scored the crucial goal, only to discover that referee Szymon Marciniak had blown his whistle after his assistant Tomasz Listkiewicz had flagged for an offside. At that stage -- in the 13th minute of added time -- Madrid were 2-1 up on the night and ahead 4-3 on aggregate following last week's 2-2 draw in Munich.\n\nDe Ligt and Bayern head coach Thomas Tuchel said in separate post-match interviews that Listkiewicz had apologised for the incident. Tuchel said it was a \"disastrous\" decision which \"feels almost like a betrayal\".\n\nHere, The Athletic breaks down the controversial end to the match.\n\nThe ball is played up towards Bayern's Nouassir Mazraoui and De Ligt as the German side chase a late equaliser in the 13th minute of added time.\n\nListkiewicz then flags for an offside as Mazraoui and De Ligt challenge for the ball against Madrid's Ferland Mendy.\n\nReplays show the decision was very close.\n\nAfter Marciniak blows the whistle, Thomas Muller latches on to the loose ball, heads it towards De Ligt who turns and volleys it into the net.\n\nMadrid's players looked to have stopped playing after hearing the whistle but Bayern players and staff were furious, berating the officials before play resumed.\n\nBayern had taken the lead in the 68th minute of the game after Alphonso Davies -- who came on in the first half for the injured Serge Gnabry -- collected a long ball from Harry Kane, cut inside and whipped a shot on his weaker right foot past Andriy Lunin.\n\nIt was another substitute who made the difference for Madrid, with Joselu equalising in the 88th minute and then scoring the winner in the 91st.\n\nThe simple answer is because the assistant referee, Listkiewicz, believed there to be an offside.\n\nHowever, since Video Assistant Referee (VAR) technology was introduced in 2016, offsides have been routinely checked after the fact.\n\nIt has become common for assistants to refrain from signalling for an offside, even if it appears obvious in real time, if play is likely to lead to a goal. If one is then scored or the play dies out, often the assistant will then raise their flag to signal an offside.\n\nThe VAR then checks the offside and either confirms the assistant's decision or reverses it. The VAR also checks for any offsides after every goal, so if an offside is missed by the assistant, a goal can still be ruled out after the fact.\n\nThe Champions League also uses semi-automated offside technology, which uses video cameras to monitor around 30 joints on each player's body.\n\nBut, as the whistle had already been blown the play was dead before De Ligt 'scored', the decision could not be reviewed by the VAR.\n\nUEFA has not responded to The Athletic's request for comment on the incident.\n\nBayern players and staff were furious after the decision was made. Tuchel was seen arguing with Listkiewicz while Muller exchanged heated words with Marciniak.\n\n\"Almost there,\" Tuchel told TNT Sports after the game. \"Very unusual mistake of the very best player (Manuel Neuer) for the equaliser. Then we conceded in a very narrow decision in stoppage time.\n\n\"Then we scored one. A disastrous decision from the linesman and the referee. It feels almost like a betrayal in the end because of that decision. It was a huge fight, we left everything on the pitch and we were almost there. Now we have to say congratulations to Real Madrid.\n\n\"The linesman said, 'Sorry' but that does not help. At this level, to raise the flag in a close position like this in the last minute. The referee as well, he does not have to whistle. He sees that we have the second ball, he sees that we get the shot away.\n\n\"To whistle is a very, very bad decision. It's against the rules. It's a bad decision from both of them and it's a disaster. It's tough to swallow but there it is.\"\n\nSpeaking to beIN Sports, De Ligt added: \"The linesman said to me, 'I'm sorry, I made a mistake'. In the end, I'm not the type of person to blame a loss on a referee. But if it's a rule it's a rule.\"\n\nAs UEFA explained in January 2023 following a course for European assistant referees in Rome: \"When the VAR system is in place for a match, assistant referees are being advised not to raise the flag if in doubt about a potential offside situation.\"\n\nUEFA's chief refereeing officer Roberto Rosetti added: \"We need the assistant referees to show their traditional abilities from the past. Accuracy, precision in offside evaluation. But timing is now an essential element of the job - they must know when to raise the flag.\n\n\"If they raise the flag at the wrong moment, problems can arise as far as the final decision is concerned. We've worked hard on the 'flag delay' concept at the course.\"\n\nThe win means Madrid will face Borussia Dortmund in next month's final at Wembley Stadium, after the German side beat Paris Saint-Germain 1-0 at the Parc des Princes in Tuesday's semi-final second leg to secure a 2-0 aggregate victory.\n\nThat game comes on Saturday, June 1 with kick-off at 8pm BST (3pm ET/12pm PT).", {"uri": "8118179648", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "23:16:16", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T23:16:16Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T23:07:57Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8039215803146362, "url": "https://www.dailymail.co.uk/wires/ap/article-13397905/De-Ligt-says-linesman-apologized-late-mistake-Bayerns-loss-Madrid-Champions-League.html", "title": "De Ligt says linesman apologized for late 'mistake' in Bayern's...", "body": "MADRID (AP) - Bayern Munich defender Matthijs de Ligt said the linesman apologized to him for raising the flag for offside before he scored what would have been a late equalizer in the Champions League semifinal against Real Madrid on Wednesday.\n\nDe Ligt scored deep into stoppage time for what would have been a 2-2 goal that likely would have sent the match into extra time at the Santiago Bernabeu Stadium. But the goal didn't count because the referee blew the whistle for the offside without letting the play be completed.\n\n\"The linesman said to me, 'I\u00b4m sorry, I made a mistake,'\" De Ligt said after the 2-1 loss in which Madrid's stoppage-time winner by Joselu came after a VAR intervention that overturned an initial offside call. In that occasion, though, the other linesman allowed the play to continue.\n\n\"The rule says that if it's not clear offside ... you have to keep playing.\" De Ligt said. \"And if you go in the last minute and you whistle like this, I think this is a big mistake. If it's offside or not, I don't know, VAR can check it, but if you don't check it, how can you see it? This is a shame.\"\n\nThe VAR also came into play in the 71st to disallow a Madrid goal because of a foul by defender Nacho Fern\u00e1ndez on Joshua Kimmich. Joselu had equalized in the 88th after a blunder by goalkeeper Manuel Neuer.\n\nThe victory sent Madrid into a final against Borussia Dortmund on June 1 in London.\n\nBayern Munich players argues with referee Szymon Marciniak at the end of the Champions League semifinal second leg soccer match between Real Madrid and Bayern Munich at the Santiago Bernabeu stadium in Madrid, Spain, Wednesday, May 8, 2024. (AP Photo/Manu Fernandez)\n\nMadrid coach Carlo Ancelotti said his defenders stopped after the whistle was blown before the De Ligt goal.\n\n\"The last play is clear, the referee blows the whistle and we stop,\" he said. \"This referee is very good, he refereed in a World Cup final. They complain about this and we complain about the goal by Nacho that was disallowed. Kimmich threw himself to the ground.\"\n\nThe match referee was Szymon Marciniak, who officiated the 2022 World Cup final between Argentina and France in Qatar.\n\nBayern coach Thomas Tuchel said it was a \"disastrous decision from the linesman and from the referee.\"\n\n\"It feels almost like a betrayal in the end because of that decision,\" he said. \"The linesman said sorry. That does not help.\n\n\"To raise the flag in a decision like this, in a close decision in the last minute, and the referee as well... The referee does not have to whistle,\" Tuchel added. \"He sees that we win the second ball, he sees that we get the shot away. To whistle is a very very bad decision. It\u00b4s against the rules and it\u00b4s a bad decision from both of them.\"\n\nAP soccer: https://apnews.com/hub/soccer\n\nBayern's Thomas Mueller reacts during the Champions League semifinal second leg soccer match between Real Madrid and Bayern Munich at the Santiago Bernabeu stadium in Madrid, Spain, Wednesday, May 8, 2024. (AP Photo/Jose Breton)\n\nBayern Munich players react at the end of the Champions League semifinal second leg soccer match between Real Madrid and Bayern Munich at the Santiago Bernabeu stadium in Madrid, Spain, Wednesday, May 8, 2024. (AP Photo/Manu Fernandez)\n\nReal Madrid's Vinicius Junior, right, is challenged by Bayern's Matthijs de Ligt during the Champions League semifinal second leg soccer match between Real Madrid and Bayern Munich at the Santiago Bernabeu stadium in Madrid, Spain, Wednesday, May 8, 2024. {"uri": "8118123680", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "22:06:38", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T22:06:38Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T22:06:10Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.800000011920929, "url": "https://www.nbcsports.com/soccer/news/matthijs-de-ligt-linesman-apologized-for-offside-call-in-champions-league-semi-big-mistake-big-disgrace", "title": "Matthijs de Ligt: Linesman apologized for offside call in Champions League semi  --  'Big mistake, big disgrace'", "body": "An epic finish to the UEFA Champions League semifinal between Real Madrid and Bayern Munich could've been even more legendary were it not for an apparent mistake from the officials on Wednesday in Spain.\n\nReal Madrid struck twice through Joselu to take a 2-1 second leg advantage and 4-3 aggregate lead over Bayern, but Matthis de Ligt seemed to have poked Bayern level in the 12th minute of stoppage time.\n\n[ MORE: Real Madrid 2-1 (4-3 agg) Bayern Munich recap, highlights ]\n\nBut no! The assistant referee had raised his flag for offside in the build-up and the referee blew the whistle before De Ligt released his shot. The whistle meant that VAR had no power to review the play for offside, and replays showed a decision would've been razor-thin.\n\nAn apology came, but it did not go over well with De Ligt and his teammates. And how could it? De Ligt could've had an all-time positive moment in Bayern history, and it didn't even merit a review.\n\nDe Ligt was asked his opinion on the moment on beIN Sports after the game.\n\n\"If it's offside, it's offside, but we made rules in football and the rule says that if it's not a clear offside, which it wasn't, you have to keep playing,\" De Ligt said. \"If you go in the last minute and you whistle like this, I think this is a big mistake and a big disgrace. If it's offside or not, I don't know, you can check it but if you don't check it how can you see it. [On] the second goal of Joselu, [Antonio] Rudiger is almost also offside. If he whistles there, nothing, but now it's a difference.\"\n\nAnd he's branding the season a lost one.\n\nWe are Bayern Munich and we haven't won anything. Today was the last chance to make a really good season and we lost. I'm proud of the fight we showed today because it's not easy to play here but in the end we won nothing so it's not really Bayern Munich. {"uri": "8118464614", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "04:42:34", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T04:42:34Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T04:40:25Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.800000011920929, "url": "https://www.latestly.com/agency-news/sports-news-de-ligt-says-linesman-apologized-for-late-mistake-in-bayerns-loss-to-madrid-in-champions-league-5951272.html", "title": "Sports News | De Ligt Says Linesman Apologized for Late 'mistake' in Bayern's Loss to Madrid in Champions League | LatestLY", "body": "Madrid, May 9 (AP) Bayern Munich defender Matthijs de Ligt said the linesman apologized to him for raising the flag for offside before he scored what would have been a late equalizer in the Champions League semifinal against Real Madrid on Wednesday.\n\nDe Ligt scored deep into stoppage time for what would have been a 2-2 goal that likely would have sent the match into extra time at the Santiago Bernabeu Stadium. But the goal didn't count because the referee blew the whistle for the offside without letting the play be completed.\n\nAlso Read | On Which Channel Pakistan vs Ireland 2024 Series Will be Telecast Live in India? How To Watch PAK vs IRE T20I Matches Live Streaming Online?.\n\n\"The linesman said to me, I'm sorry, I made a mistake,'\" De Ligt said after the 2-1 loss in which Madrid's stoppage-time winner by Joselu came after a VAR intervention that overturned an initial offside call. In that occasion, though, the other linesman allowed the play to continue.\n\n\"The rule says that if it's not clear offside ... you have to keep playing.\" De Ligt said. \"And if you go in the last minute and you whistle like this, I think this is a big mistake. If it's offside or not, I don't know, VAR can check it, but if you don't check it, how can you see it? This is a shame.\"\n\nAlso Read | LSG Owner Sanjiv Goenka Caught on Camera Having Intense Conversation With KL Rahul Following 10-Wicket Defeat Against SunRisers Hyderabad in IPL 2024 (Watch Video).\n\nThe VAR also came into play in the 71st to disallow a Madrid goal because of a foul by defender Nacho Fern\u00e1ndez on Joshua Kimmich. Joselu had equalized in the 88th after a blunder by goalkeeper Manuel Neuer.\n\nThe victory sent Madrid into a final against Borussia Dortmund on June 1 in London.\n\nMadrid coach Carlo Ancelotti said his defenders stopped after the whistle was blown before the De Ligt goal.\n\n\"The last play is clear, the referee blows the whistle and we stop,\" he said. \"This referee is very good, he refereed in a World Cup final. They complain about this and we complain about the goal by Nacho that was disallowed. Kimmich threw himself to the ground.\"\n\nThe match referee was Szymon Marciniak, who officiated the 2022 World Cup final between Argentina and France in Qatar.\n\nBayern coach Thomas Tuchel said it was a \"disastrous decision from the linesman and from the referee.\"\n\n\"It feels almost like a betrayal in the end because of that decision,\" he said. \"The linesman said sorry. That does not help.\n\n\"To raise the flag in a decision like this, in a close decision in the last minute, and the referee as well... The referee does not have to whistle,\" Tuchel added. \"He sees that we win the second ball, he sees that we get the shot away. To whistle is a very very bad decision. However, the goal did not count as the referee blew the whistle for offside before the play could be completed.\n\n\"The linesman said to me, 'I'm sorry, I made a mistake,'\" De Ligt said after the 2-1 loss, during which Madrid secured a stoppage-time winner by Joselu following a VAR intervention that overturned an initial offside call. However, on that occasion, the other linesman allowed the play to continue.\n\n\"The rule says that if it's not clear offside ... you have to keep playing,\" De Ligt emphasized. \"And if you go in the last minute and you whistle like this, I think this is a big mistake. If it's offside or not, I don't know, VAR can check it, but if you don't check it, how can you see it? {"uri": "8118854398", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "09:30:15", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T09:30:15Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T09:29:51Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7803921699523926, "url": "https://sportsbrief.com/football/64665-how-offside-calls-supposed-work-real-madrid-versus-bayern-munich-controversy/", "title": "How Offside Calls Are Supposed to Work After Real Madrid Versus Bayern Munich Controversy", "body": "\"It was a disastrous decision from the linesman and the referee. It was a huge call, which was the wrong call. It is against every rule. That would not have happened on the other side. It feels like a betrayal.\"\n\nTo say that Thomas Tuchel was beyond livid with the controversial offside decision during the second leg of Bayern Munich's game against Real Madrid on May 8 would be an understatement.\n\nThe Bavarian giants thought they had scored what would have forced the already dramatic tie to extra time, but the linesman's flag and referee's whistle brought those hopes to a grinding halt.\n\nFor context, the German side were on the cusp of knocking out the record champions after a sublime Alphonso Davies gaol in the 68th minute. However, former Stoke City player, Joselu, came off the bench to score twice in quick succession - the first from a Manuel Neuer mistake - to send Carlo Ancelotti's side through to Wembley.\n\nDeep into stoppage time, Matthijs de Ligt found the back of the net, but the goal couldn't stand or even be referred to the Video Assistant Referee because referee, Szymon Marciniak, had blown the whistle before the Dutch defender had even touched the ball. Fury then followed from Bayern players and those in the team's technical area.\n\nThe German contingent wanted to understand why the referee did not allow that phase of play to end before raising the flag, as it has become the norm. In new rules introduced in the 2021/2022 season, it was agreed that the linesman will intentionally delay raising his flag if he thinks it's an offside.\n\n\"When an immediate goalscoring opportunity is likely to occur, the assistant referee will keep their flag down if they think there is an offside until the passage of play is completed. Once a goal is scored or the chance is gone, the assistant will raise the flag to indicate the initial offence,\" the Premier League website explains.\n\nThe decision will then be referred to the VAR for a final decision to be made.\n\nIn this situation, when Thomas Muller headed down the ball for De Ligt, the linesman was supposed to see how things panned out before raising his flag. Once Marciniak saw the flag, he blew the whistle and Real Madrid players stopped playing even as the ball struck the back of the net.\n\nThe decision couldn't be referred to the VAR because the whistle had already gone, rendering everything as De Ligt played the ball 'inadmissible'.\n\nThere is no telling whether the referee's offside decision was correct, but Bayern deserved the benefit of the doubt. The linesman, as confirmed by Tuchel and De Ligt, did apologise for his mistake, but it was a tad too late.\n\nThierry Henry, who was on pundit duties for CBS, took issue with the centre referee and summarised it perfectly.\n\n\"My view isn't with the linesman. My issue is with the referee. He is the chief. Why do you blow your whistle when you have something [the VAR] that can tell you whether it is offside or not?\"\n\nSports Brief has also reported that Carlo Ancelotti fired back at Thomas Tuchel over the controversial offside decision.\n\nThe veteran Italian manager masterminded another Champions League comeback, but the tie ended in contentious fashion.\n\nHe picked out Real Madrid's goal, which was disallowed for a Nacho Fernandez foul on Joshua Kimmich, as an example.", "source": {"uri": "sportsbrief.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "sportsbrief.com"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": {"uri": "2024-05-349956559", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "08:31:48", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T08:31:48Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T08:27:49Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7803921699523926, "url": "https://www.myjoyonline.com/tuchel-says-offside-decision-felt-like-betrayal-2/", "title": "Tuchel says offside decision 'felt like betrayal'", "body": "Bayern Munich manager Thomas Tuchel said the decision from officials to stop play before his side scored a stoppage-time equaliser against Real Madrid \"feels like a betrayal\".\n\nBayern led 1-0 in the second leg of their Champions League semi-final up until the 88th minute, when substitute Joselu scored twice in three minutes.\n\nWith Bayern trailing 2-1 in the 13th minute of stoppage time, Matthijs de Ligt thought he had equalised but assistant referee Tomasz Listkiewicz had already raised his flag for offside.\n\nReal defenders stopped before De Ligt fired into the net and television replays showed the original decision may not have been offside and would have needed to be checked by video assistant referee (VAR).\n\nBecause play had been stopped, VAR was unable to intervene. Tuchel told TNT Sports \"it was a very, very bad decision\" and \"against the rules\".\n\n\"There was a disastrous decision from the linesman and the referee. It feels like a betrayal in the end,\" he said.\n\n\"The linesman says sorry but that does not help. To raise the flag in a moment like this...\n\n\"The referee sees we get the second ball and we get the shot.\n\n\"It's hard to swallow but that's the way it is.\"\n\nTuchel later confirmed referee Szymon Marciniak, who took charge of the 2022 World Cup final, also apologised, but said it \"does not help\".\n\n\"Everyone has to go to their limit; everyone has to suffer; everyone has to play without making mistakes. So the referee has to be at that level too,\" said Tuchel.\n\n\"It just doesn't help to make excuses after the fact. You are on the field for this reason, because you are the best there is. {"uri": "8118165869", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "22:54:31", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T22:54:31Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T22:54:02Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7803921699523926, "url": "https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/bayern-munich-goal-disallowed-real-madrid-tuchel-b2541915.html", "title": "Thomas Tuchel claims 'betrayal' after controversial moment in semi-final", "body": "Hosts Madrid pulled off a stunning late comeback at the Bernabeu as substitute Joselu came off the bench to turn the tie around in the final minutes, after Bayern had led thanks to a Alphonso Davies strike.\n\nBut Bayern had the ball in the net again in the dying seconds of injury time, as Matthijs de Ligt thrashed a shot in from just inside the Real Madrid box following a long ball into the penalty area.\n\nThe goal was quickly ruled out as the assistant referee's flag was raised and the whistle went a couple of seconds before De Ligt shot. Noussair Mazraoui and De Ligt were given offside, but replays showed it was close.\n\nTuchel was furious that the offside flag had not been delayed in order to let the attacking phase play out, as is the protocol in the age of VAR. As the flag went up, however, VAR was unable to intervene and award the goal, as play had already stopped.\n\n\"There was a disastrous decision from the linesman and the referee [Poland's Szymon Marciniak],\" Tuchel told TNT Sports. \" It feels like a betrayal in the end. There was a huge fight, we left everything on the pitch and we were almost there. Now we say congratulations to Real Madrid.\n\n\"The linesman says sorry but that does not help. To raise the flag in a moment like this... The referee sees we get the second ball and we get the shot - it's a very, very bad decision. It's against the rules. It's a disaster. It's hard to swallow but that's the way it is.\"\n\nThe Real Madrid goalkeeper Andriy Lunin appeared to stop before De Ligt shot, having already heard the offside flag.\n\nTuchel also defended taking off Harry Kane in the 85th minute and with Bayern only a goal up by explaining that the England captain had \"back problems\" and could not continue.\n\nKane is Bayern's leading goalscorer this season with 44 goals from 45 goals in his debut season at the German club, including eight in the Champions League, but was replaced by Eric Maxim Choupo-Moting, who has scored three goals in all competitions this campaign.\n\nExtra time was still a possibility, Joselu then scored again in the 92nd minute to send Madrid through to the final. Joselu's equaliser came after a costly spill from Bayern goalkeeper Manuel Neuer, who had been the player of the match until that point.\n\nTuchel told TNT Sports that he had no choice but to take off his attackers and said Bayern saw the \"end of the tunnel\" before Madrid's late comeback.\n\n\"You are never fully sure because it's Real Madrid in Madrid. We could have been more clinical or calm in the opponent's half. We started with a front four and all four has to go out with injury or cramp.\n\n\"Yeah because if you are through in the 88th minute you see the end of the tunnel. Was it our very best match? {"uri": "8118145035", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "22:28:53", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T22:28:53Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T22:28:14Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7764706015586853, "url": "https://metro.co.uk/2024/05/08/thomas-tuchel-reveals-linesman-admission-controversy-bayern-munich-loss-real-madrid-20802721/", "title": "Tuchel reveals linesman's admission after controversial call in Bayern defeat", "body": "Bayern Munich manager Thomas Tuchel says the linesman apologised to him after making a 'disastrous decision' late in Bayern Munich's 2-1 defeat to Real Madrid in the Champions League semi-final on Wednesday night.\n\nThe dramatic game in Madrid came after a 2-2 draw in Munich and the deadlock was broken on 68 minutes thanks to a stunning Alphonso Davies goal for Bayern.\n\nThe home team equalised through substitute Joselu on 88 minutes after a Manuel Neuer blunder and Joselu scored again just three minutes later to turn things around completely.\n\nBayern then had the ball in the net through Konrad Laimer, but the linesman had already flagged for an offside against Noussair Mazraoui.\n\nReplays showed that Mazraoui may have in fact been onside and it was certainly far too tight a call for the linesman to flag and not wait for VAR.\n\nWhether or not the full-back actually was offside was not clarified, while Real Madrid defenders and goalkeeper did pause after seeing the flag, so there is no guarantee that Laimer would have scored anyway, but Tuchel was fuming and the linesman admitted he was wrong.\n\n'Almost through, almost there, then a very unusual mistake of our very best player for the equaliser,' Tuchel told TNT Sports. 'Then we conceded in a very narrow decision, the second one in stoppage time. Then we scored one.\n\n'They have a disastrous decision from the linesman and from the referee. It feels almost like a betrayal in the end because of that decision. It was a huge fight, we left everything on the pitch, we were almost there. Now we have to say congratulations to Real Madrid.\n\n'The linesman said sorry, but that does not help on that kind of level. To raise the flag in a decision like this, a close decision in the last minute. And the referee as well, the referee does not have to whistle. He sees that we win the second ball, he sees that we get a shot away. To whistle is a very, very bad decision.\n\n'It's against the rules and it's a bad decision from both of them. It's a disaster. Tough to swallow but that's the way it is.'\n\nBayern defender Matthijs de Ligt echoed his manager's thoughts, slamming the 'big mistake' from the officials.\n\n\"If it's offside, it's offside. But we made rules in football, if it's not a clear offside, which it wasn't because I haven't seen yet if it was offside or not, you have to keep playing,' said the Dutchman.\n\n'If you go in the last minute, whistle like this, I think this is a big, big mistake. This is a shame. The linesman said to me, \"I'm sorry, I made a mistake.\"\n\n'In the end I'm not the type of person who wants to blame a win or a lose on the referee. Madrid deserves to win because they win 2-1. But if it is a rule it is a rule.'\n\nMORE : Bayern Munich's Manuel Neuer speaks out after making Champions League howler in Real Madrid defeat\n\nMORE : Thomas Tuchel explains controversial Harry {"uri": "2024-05-349872644", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "07:11:42", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T07:11:42Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T06:39:30Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.772549033164978, "url": "https://www.sportskeeda.com/football/news-kimmich-dived-real-madrid-boss-carlo-ancelotti-provides-emphatic-response-bayern-munich-complaints-late-offside-call", "title": "\"Kimmich dived\" - Real Madrid boss Carlo Ancelotti provides emphatic response to Bayern Munich complaints on late offside call", "body": "Real Madrid boss Carlo Ancelotti has responded to Bayern Munich's complaints about Matthijs de Ligt's late equaliser chalked off for a contentious offside. Los Blancos scored twice late on to reach a record extending 18th UEFA Champions League final.\n\nIn a rousing semifinal second leg at the Santiago Bernabeu on Wednesday (May 8), both sides had scoring opportunities before Alphonso Davies' brilliant curler gave Bayern the lead midway through the second half.\n\nMoments later, Nacho's equaliser was cancelled out due to foul on Joshua Kimmich in the build-up, which Ancelotti says was a 'dive' from the player. Nevertheless, Los Blancos perservered, capitalising on a rare error from the excellent Manuel Neuer to score an 88th-minute equaliser through substitute Joselu.\n\nThere was more drama in store, though. In the first minute of stoppage time, Antonio Rudiger squared to an unmarked Joselu at the far post for Los Blancos' winner, but De Ligt thought he bagged the equaliser.\n\nHowever, the referee called early for offside, and play stopped, with Ancelotti admitting that the Bayern defender might not have been offside. The Italian, though, added that his team stopped playing, as the referee had called offside before the ball had gone in\n\n\"Bayern complaining about the offside? OK, then we complain about the cancelled goal of Nacho. Kimmich dived,\" he said (as per Bayern & Germany via Madrid Xtra).\n\nAbout De Ligt's offside call, the Real Madrid boss added:\n\n\"The offside episode is simple to explain. Maybe it wasn't offside, but the referee whistled (before the goal), and we stopped playing. That's it.\"\n\nReal Madrid eventually hung on to book a final date with Borussia Dortmund on June 1 at the Wembley as Bayern Munich wonder what might have been.\n\n\"There was a disastrous decision from the linesman and the referee\" - Bayern Munich boss on offside call against Real Madrid\n\nBayern Munich boss Thomas Tuchel understandably had a different take on De Ligt's goal wrongly ruled out for suspected offside against Real Madrid.\n\nThe outgoing Bayern tactician bemoaned the 'disastrous' decision from the on-field officials. Had play continued, VAR would have allowed the goal to stand, but that wasn't the case, as the linesman prematurely called offside, which incensed Tuchel.\n\n\"There was a disastrous decision from the linesman and the referee,\" he told TNT Sports (via BBC). \"It feels like a betrayal in the end. The linesman says sorry. but that does not help. To raise the flag in a moment like this ... The referee sees we get the second ball, and we get the shot. It's hard to swallow, but that's the way it is.\"\n\nDespite referee Szymon Marciniak and the linesman apologising to Bayern for the wrong call, an aggrieved Tuchel added:\n\n\"Everyone has to go to their limit, everyone has to suffer, everyone has to play without making mistakes. So the referee has to be at that level too.\n\n\"It just doesn't help to make excuses after the fact. You are on the field for this reason, because you are the best there is. And we have the right to expect that until the end.\"\n\nBayern Munich are set to endure a first trophyless season since 2011-12, while Real Madrid will gun for a record-extending 15th UEFA Champions Then we scored one and they have a disastrous decision from the linesman and from the referee.\n\n'So, it feels almost like a betrayal in the end because of that decision. It was a huge fight, we left everything on the pitch and we were almost there. Now we have to say congratulations to Real Madrid.'\n\n'The linesman said sorry, but that does not help. {"uri": "8118191263", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "23:23:02", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T23:23:02Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T23:22:26Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7686274647712708, "url": "https://expressdigest.com/matthijs-de-ligt-reveals-what-linesman-said-to-him-after-his-errant-flag-denied-bayern-munich-late-equaliser-against-real-madrid/", "title": "Matthijs De Ligt reveals what linesman said to him after his errant flag denied Bayern Munich late equaliser against Real Madrid", "body": "Another nightmare... which players are to blame and should Thomas Tuchel come in? Listen to the It's All Kicking Off! Man United Crisis Special podcast\n\nBayern Munich Matthijs De Ligt has revealed what the linesman said to him after his late goal against Real Madrid was controversially ruled out.\n\nReal were leading 4-3 on aggregate when De Ligt found the net deep into injury time at the end of the second half.\n\nThe linesman had already flagged for offside, which meant that VAR couldn't intervene, and the goal wasn't allowed to stand.\n\nDe Ligt was let hugely frustrated by the decision, especially given that his goal would have taken the game to extra-time.\n\nAs it transpired, Real prevailed, with substitute Joselu the hero with two goals.\n\nMatthijs De Ligt revealed what the linesman said to him after his late goal was ruled out\n\nBayern's Noussair Mazraoui had been deemed to be offside before De Ligt had struck the ball\n\nDe Ligt revealed that the linesman apologised to him for the decision.\n\nDe Ligt told beIN SPORTS: 'If it's offside, it's offside. But I think we made rules in football and the rules are if's not a clear offside - which it wasn't because I don't see it yet if it's offside or not - you have to keep playing.\n\n'If you go in the last minutes and you whistle like this, I think it's a big mistake. If it's offside or not you can check it, but if you don't check it, how can you see it? The second goal Rudiger is almost offside. If he whistles ok, but now there's a difference and this is a shame.\n\n'The linesman said to me I'm sorry, I made a mistake, I can't buy anything for that. I'm not the type of person who wants to blame a loss or win on the referee but it means you have to win because you win 2-1. I think if it's a rule, it's a rule.'\n\nPaul Scholes claimed that the linesman was too quick to put his flag up.\n\nSpeaking on TNT Sports, Scholes said: 'I'm not sure it's offside. For the linesman to put his flag up... he's too hasty. He's got to wait.'\n\nDe Ligt revealed that the linesman apologised to him after his goal was disallowed\n\nBayern's Noussair Mazraoui had been deemed to be offside before De Ligt had struck the ball.\n\nReplays showed that it was a close call and that Mazraoui may well have been onside.\n\nAfter a 2-2 draw in the first leg, Bayern took the lead in the second leg through Alphonso {"uri": "8118111575", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "21:54:04", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T21:54:04Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T21:53:22Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7686274647712708, "url": "https://www.sportingnews.com/au/champions-league/news/bayern-munich-goal-disallowed-error-offside-real-madrid-champions/c3f707628b3050fdf46fee13", "title": "Bayern Munich offside call: Why De Ligt goal vs Real Madrid in Champions League was disallowed without VAR", "body": "Real Madrid completed a miraculous comeback against Bayern Munich in the second leg of their Champions League semifinal, reaching the European title match against Borussia Dortmund by a 4-3 aggregate score.\n\nJoselu's late brace off the bench snatched victory from the jaws of defeat as the German side collapsed at the Bernabeu, appearing to be through on an Alphonso Davies thunderbolt but failing to hang on in a 2-1 defeat.\n\nHowever, the result didn't come without enormous controversy, as Bayern Munich had a late equalising goal by Matthijs de Ligt deep in stoppage time ruled out for offside. The assistant referee flagged for offside in the buildup to rule out the goal, and while replays appeared to show the decision was incorrect, it was not reviewed by VAR.\n\nThe Sporting News explains exactly what happened and why the goal was chalked off, and not reviewed by the offside technology.\n\nMORE: When is the Champions League final between Real Madrid and Borussia Dortmund?\n\nWith Real Madrid up 2-1 and the match deep into nine minutes of stoppage time, Bayern Munich threw everything forward hoping for a last-gasp equaliser to send the match to extra-time.\n\nA ball from deep was delivered by Bayern Munich towards the top of the penalty area, where Noussair Mazraoui battled for the ball with a defender. With the ball bobbling around, Bayern substitute Thomas Muller pounced, nodding it laterally to defender Matthijs de Ligt who was playing up as a striker as a desperation play from manager Thomas Tuchel.\n\nDe Ligt managed to turn his defender and get on the ball, and rifled a shot past a confused Andriy Lunin who stood still almost as if he had stopped playing. That's because he had indeed stopped playing, because the whistle had blown prior to De Ligt's shot.\n\nThe official had blown his whistle, reacting to the assistant referee who had raised his flag for an offside offence on Mazraoui in the buildup. However, replays in the immediate aftermath showed that Mazraoui was quite tight with Real Madrid defender Antonio Rudiger, and may have actually been onside -- De Ligt was leaning just off, but he did not receive the ball from deep, Mazraoui did, and he was just behind Rudiger.\n\nNo worry, we have semi-automated offside technology to correct the decision, which came into play earlier in the match, seeing a Vinicius Jr goal count after initially being disallowed. Except, it wasn't...why?\n\nMORE: Recap the thrilling Champions League semifinal between Real Madrid and Bayern Munich\n\nWith the incident happening at the very end of the match between Real Madrid and Bayern Munich, broadcasters didn't have ample time to inform fans about what happened, and thus viewers will have been left confused about why the Matthijs de Ligt goal wasn't given after being initially ruled out for offside.\n\nIn fact, the incident wasn't even reviewed by VAR, because technically, it never happened. Because the referee blew his whistle before the end of the play, the shot cannot be reviewed by VAR as he stopped play before the shot occurred. That is why Real Madrid goalkeeper Andriy Lunin was standing still as De Ligt put the ball in the net, because he had reacted to the whistle.\n\nThus, the play was not reviewable by VAR. Ever since the introduction of VAR, assistant referees have been instructed to leave their flag down for an extra few beats to allow play to continue, such that if their decision is incorrect, they do not stop a promising attack with the wrong call.\n\nHowever, that instruction was not heeded here by either the assistant referee or the head official. Instead, the AR raised his flag immediately, and the head official blew his whistle in response, ending play early. While the decision would normally have been reviewable had the official not stopped play early, because he blew the play dead, it could not be reviewed.\n\nIt was a sharp departure from a refereeing mantra that has been in place for years, ever since VAR was introduced. While television broadcasters repeatedly complain about officials letting play continue, in their mind, too long before blowing dead for offside, this exact situation is what they are hoping to prevent by doing so.", "source": {"uri": "sportingnews.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Sporting News"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Real_Madrid_CF", "type": {"uri": "8118506948", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "05:20:43", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T05:20:43Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T05:20:18Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7607843279838562, "url": "https://www.indiatoday.in/sports/football/story/bayern-munich-boss-tuchel-slams-late-offside-after-loss-to-real-madrid-2536958-2024-05-09", "title": "Feels like a betrayal: Bayern boss Tuchel slams late offside after loss to Real Madrid", "body": "Real Madrid to face Borussia Dortmund in the Champions League final on June 1\n\nBayern Munich manager Thomas Tuchel believes officials' decision to halt play before his team secured an injury-time equaliser against Real Madrid \"feels like a betrayal\". The Germans were leading 1-0 in the second leg of their Champions League semi-final until the 88th minute, when substitute Joselu struck twice in three minutes. With Bayern behind 2-1 in the 13th minute of stoppage time, Matthijs de Ligt felt he had equalised, but the assistant referee's flag had already been raised for offside. Real defenders came to a halt before De Ligt blasted into the net, and television replays revealed that the original ruling may not have been offside and would have required review by a visual assistance referee [VAR].\n\n\"I think it's pretty clear and there is no doubt that is against the rules of modern football,\" Bayern coach Thomas Tuchel said. \"A disaster. An absolute disaster. With Real's second goal, they let the play continue. The clear rule is that the scene must continue. The first mistake was made by the linesman, the second by the referee,\" he said. Bayern seized the lead with Alphonso Davies' shot midway through the second half, but Real rallied with two late goals from Joselu to secure the final berth. De Ligt claimed the linesman apologised to him after the game.\n\n\"Very difficult. Of course as sportspeople we accept it,\" said Tuchel. \"But it is a semi-final, it's not for two such violations of the rule. Everyone has to be at their limit. The referees have to be there as well. That is what we expect. So the apology does not really help.\" Bayern goalkeeper Manuel Neuer spilled the ball into Joselu's path for the equaliser in the 88th minute, but Tuchel refused to criticise his keeper, who had been superb up to that moment.\n\n\"Ninety-nine out of 100 times he makes it. It is just very, very bitter. No-one will point a finger at him and he is the most unhappy one,\" said the coach.\n\nReal Madrid reached their sixth Champions League final in ten years, where they will face Borussia Dortmund for a record-extending 15th trophy on June 1 at Wembley Stadium.", "source": {"uri": "indiatoday.in", "dataType": "news", "title": "India Today"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": Since the flag was up before the goal was scored, the Video Assistant Referee nor the centre referee could intervene.\n\nThis sparked a series of protests from the Bayern Munich bench but that didn't change anything as the decision stood.\n\n\"If it's offside, it's offside.
